meanings.definition: To make or become fresh or fresher.
meanings.sent1: She freshens her room by opening the windows and letting in the cool air.
meanings.sent2: The mint gum freshens your breath instantly.
meanings.sent3: The magic potion freshens up the old book, making it look brand new.
meanings.sent4: Laughter is like a breeze that freshens the stale air of a bad mood.
meanings.sent5: The rain freshens the earth, bringing new life to the plants and flowers.

meanings.definition: To add fresh ingredients or flavors to something.
meanings.sent1: Mom freshens the salad with a squeeze of lemon juice.
meanings.sent2: The chef freshens up the pasta dish with a sprinkle of herbs.
meanings.sent3: The surprise ingredient she added freshens the taste of the soup.
meanings.sent4: His creativity freshens the traditional recipe, giving it a modern twist.
meanings.sent5: The burst of citrus freshens the flavor of the drink, making it more refreshing.

meanings.sent1: A good night's sleep freshens your mind for the challenges of the day.
meanings.sent2: The rain freshens the dry soil, bringing life back to the garden.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected plot twist freshens the storyline, keeping the audience engaged.
meanings.sent4: Her smile freshens his spirits, brightening up his day.
meanings.sent5: The new coat of paint freshens the old house, making it look vibrant again.
